千乘之國.definition: (archaic) a state with a thousand chariots (to fight a war) – a powerful state

千位.definition: the thousands place (or column) in the decimal system

千兒八百.definition: (coll.) one thousand or almost one thousand

千刀萬剮.definition: (idiom) to hack (sb) to pieces (punishment in former times)

千千萬萬.definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers; innumerable; thousands upon thousands

千古.definition: for all eternity; throughout all ages; eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)

千叮萬囑.definition: repeatedly urging; imploring over and over again

千姿百態.definition: (idiom) to come in many different shapes; to display a great variety of forms

千字文.definition: Thousand Character Classic, 6th century poem used as a traditional reading primer

千山區.definition: Qianshan district of Anshan city 鞍山市[An1 shan1 shi4], Liaoning

千島湖.definition: Qiandao Lake in Zhejiang, aka Xin'an River Reservoir, created as part of a large hydroelectric project in 1959

千島群島.definition: Kuril Islands, archipelago in Sakhalin, far-eastern Russia

千慮一失.definition: reflect a thousand times and you can still make a mistake (idiom); to err is human

千慮一得.definition: a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.

千方百計.definition: lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means

千瘡百孔.definition: see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]

千真萬確.definition: absolutely true (idiom); manifold; true from many points of view

千禧年.definition: the first year of a millennium (esp. the year 2000)

千篇一律.definition: thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive; once you've seen one, you've seen them all

千萬.definition: ten million; countless; many; one must by all means

千言萬語.definition: thousands of words (idiom); having a lot of things to say; talking nonstop

千軍易得，一將難求.pinyin: qian1 jun1 yi4 de2 , yi1 jiang4 nan2 qiu2
千軍易得，一將難求.definition: Easy to raise an army of one thousand, but hard to find a good general. (idiom)

千軍萬馬.definition: magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower; all the King's horses and all the King's men

千載難逢.definition: extremely rare (idiom); once in a blue moon

千辛萬苦.definition: to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations; with difficulty; after some effort

千里.definition: a thousand miles; a thousand li (i.e. 500 kilometers); a long distance

千里之堤，毀於蟻穴.pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 di1 , hui3 yu2 yi3 xue2
千里之堤，毀於蟻穴.definition: see 千里之堤，潰於蟻穴|千里之堤，溃于蚁穴[qian1li3 zhi1 di1, kui4 yu2 yi3xue2]

千里之堤，潰於蟻穴.pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 di1 , kui4 yu2 yi3 xue2
千里之堤，潰於蟻穴.definition: lit. an ant hole may cause the collapse of a great dike (idiom); fig. huge damage may result from a moment's negligence

千里之行，始於足下.pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4
千里之行，始於足下.definition: lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step; fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one

千里寄鵝毛.definition: goose feather sent from afar (idiom); a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it; also written 千里送鵝毛|千里送鹅毛

千里搭長棚，沒有不散的宴席.pinyin: qian1 li3 da1 chang2 peng2 , mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan4 xi2
千里搭長棚，沒有不散的宴席.definition: even if you build a thousand-league awning for it, every banquet must come to an end (idiom)

千里送鵝毛.definition: goose feather sent from afar (idiom); a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it

千里送鵝毛，禮輕人意重.pinyin: qian1 li3 song4 e2 mao2 , li3 qing1 ren2 yi4 zhong4
千里送鵝毛，禮輕人意重.definition: goose feather sent from afar, a slight present but weighty meaning (idiom); It's not the present the counts, it's the thought behind it.

千里送鵝毛，禮輕情意重.pinyin: qian1 li3 song4 e2 mao2 , li3 qing1 qing2 yi4 zhong4
千里送鵝毛，禮輕情意重.definition: goose feather sent from afar, a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it (idiom); It's not the gift that counts, but the thought behind it.

千里達及托巴哥.pinyin: Qian1 li3 da2 ji2 Tuo1 ba1 ge1

千里達和多巴哥.pinyin: Qian1 li3 da2 he2 Duo1 ba1 ge1

千里馬.definition: lit. ten thousand mile horse; fine steed

千里馬常有，而伯樂不常有.pinyin: qian1 li3 ma3 chang2 you3 , er2 Bo2 le4 bu4 chang2 you3
千里馬常有，而伯樂不常有.definition: lit. there are many swift horses, but very few who can spot them (proverb); fig. many have talent, but few can recognize talent when they see it

千里鵝毛.definition: goose feather sent from afar (idiom); a trifling gift with a weighty thought behind it; also written 千里送鵝毛|千里送鹅毛[qian1 li3 song4 e2 mao2]

千金.definition: thousand jin 斤 (pounds) of gold; money and riches; (honorific) invaluable (support); (honorific) daughter

千金一擲.definition: lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly; extravagant

千金一諾.definition: a promise worth one thousand in gold (idiom); a promise that must be kept

千金方.definition: Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold, early Tang compendium of herbal medicine by Sun Simiao 孫思邈|孙思邈[Sun1 Si1 miao3]

千金要方.definition: Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold, early Tang compendium of herbal medicine by Sun Simiao 孫思邈|孙思邈[Sun1 Si1 miao3]

千金難買.definition: can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)

千鈞一髮.definition: lit. a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom); fig. (at the) critical; perilous (moment)

千錘百鍊.definition: after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom); the vicissitudes of life

千陽.definition: Qianyang County in Baoji 寶雞|宝鸡[Bao3 ji1], Shaanxi

千陽縣.definition: Qianyang County in Baoji 寶雞|宝鸡[Bao3 ji1], Shaanxi

千頭萬緒.definition: plethora of things to tackle; multitude of loose ends; very complicated; chaotic
